name: Tussar Silk Sarees
description: Renowned for their rich texture and natural golden hue, symbolizing Bihar’s textile heritage.
details: Produced mainly in Bhagalpur, these sarees are lightweight, breathable, and often feature motifs inspired by nature and traditional art.

name: Dhoti-Kurta
description: Traditional attire for men, representing simplicity and cultural identity.
details: The dhoti is wrapped around the waist while the kurta is a loose tunic, commonly worn during festivals, rituals, and ceremonies.

name: Bhagalpuri Silk
description: Known as the ‘Queen of Fabrics’ for its durability and elegant texture.
details: Used to create sarees, suits, and dupattas, Bhagalpuri silk is prized for its breathability and graceful drape.

name: Madhubani Print Attire
description: Modern garments featuring the iconic Madhubani art form.
details: Traditional Madhubani motifs are hand-painted or printed on kurtas, sarees, and dupattas, blending folk art with contemporary fashion.

name: Sujini Embroidered Textiles
description: Narrative embroidery textiles depicting social stories and folklore.
details: Sujini embroidery uses running stitches on layered fabric, transforming garments into storytelling canvases.

name: Khatwa Appliqué Work
description: Colorful appliqué designs used on garments and furnishings.
details: Fabric patches are cut into shapes and stitched onto base cloth to create vibrant decorative patterns.

name: Traditional Cotton Weaves
description: Comfortable and durable cotton textiles for everyday wear.
details: Handloom cotton weaving is practiced across Bihar, producing breathable fabrics suitable for daily use.

name: Mithila Paag
description: Traditional headgear symbolizing honor and cultural pride.
details: Worn during ceremonies and special occasions, the Paag reflects the wearer’s status and regional identity.
